sentence.Network_en: Scarborough Council commissioned geological experts earlier this year to survey the cliffs.
sentence.Network_cn: 斯卡伯勒市政会在今年早些时候委托地质专家对这些悬崖进行勘测。

sentence.Network_en: A second book has already been commissioned and is two-thirds finished.
sentence.Network_cn: 已经委托作者撰写第二本书，现在完成了2/3。

sentence.Network_en: The Ministry of Agriculture commissioned a study into low-input farming.
sentence.Network_cn: 农业部委托对低投入耕作进行研究。

entry.def: If you commission something or commission someone to do something, you formally arrange for someone to do a piece of work for you.

example.ex: The Ministry of Agriculture commissioned a study into low-input farming...
example.tran: 农业部委托对低投入耕作进行研究。

example.ex: You can commission them to paint something especially for you.
example.tran: 你可以委托他们专门为你画点什么。

entry.tran: 受托之事;(接受报酬的)任务
entry.def: A commission is a piece of work that someone is asked to do and is paid for.

example.ex: Just a few days ago, I finished a commission.
example.tran: 就在几天前，我完成了一项委托创作任务。

entry.def: Commission is a sum of money paid to a salesperson for every sale that he or she makes. If a salesperson is paid on commission, the amount they receive depends on the amount they sell.

example.ex: The salesmen work on commission only...
example.tran: 销售人员只根据销售量提取佣金。

example.ex: He also got a commission for bringing in new clients.
example.tran: 他还因为带来了很多新客户拿到一笔佣金。

entry.tran: (银行或公司收取的)服务费，手续费
entry.def: If a bank or other company charges commission, they charge a fee for providing a service, for example for exchanging money or issuing an insurance policy.

example.ex: Travel agents charge 1 per cent commission on sterling cheques...
example.tran: 旅行社对英镑支票收取1%的服务费。

example.ex: Sellers pay a fixed commission fee.
example.tran: 卖方支付固定的服务费。

entry.def: A commission is a group of people who have been appointed to find out about something or to control something.

example.ex: The authorities have been asked to set up a commission to investigate the murders.
example.tran: 当局被敦促成立一个委员会负责调查这些谋杀案。

entry.def: The commission of a crime is the act of committing a crime.

example.ex: If a person uses a gun in the commission of a crime, then he should be given an additional penalty.
example.tran: 如果使用枪支进行犯罪，就应该受到额外的惩罚。

entry.def: If a member of the armed forces receives a commission, he or she becomes an officer.

example.ex: He accepted a commission as a naval officer.
example.tran: 他接受任命成为一名海军军官。

entry.def: If a member of the armed forces is commissioned, he or she is made an officer.

example.ex: He was commissioned as second lieutenant in the Air Force...
Only commissioned officers qualify for the Military Cross.
example.tran: 只有持委任状的军官才有资格获得十字勋章。

entry.tran: (船、设备等)坏了的，不能使用的
entry.def: If something, for example a ship or a piece of equipment, is out of commission, it is broken and cannot be used until it is repaired.

example.ex: The operator expects the ship to be out of commission until the end of September.
example.tran: 技工预计这艘船到9月底才能修好。

means.word_mean: 1. of military officers; holding by virtue of a commission a rank of second lieutenant or ensign or above

auth_sentence.content: That is why I've commissioned this independent review.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is why I've commissioned this independent review.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is why I've commissioned this independent review.

auth_sentence.content: I think there may have been other remixes commissioned.
auth_sentence.res_content: I think there may have been other remixes commissioned.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think there may have been other remixes commissioned.

auth_sentence.content: Both inquiries have been commissioned by the BBC Executive Board.
auth_sentence.res_content: Both inquiries have been commissioned by the BBC Executive Board.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Both inquiries have been commissioned by the BBC Executive Board.

Sentence.sentence: minister of social security, quickly commissioned a study to determine the causes of and possible cures for this disturbing stale of affairs.
